answers.text: convert between high-speed USB 2.0 buses and full and low speed buses

qas.question: When does a USB 2.0 hub operate in high speed mode?

answers.text: When a high-speed USB 2.0 hub is plugged into a high-speed USB host or hub

qas.question: What kind of devices do High speed USB 2.0's contain?

context: High-speed USB 2.0 hubs contain devices called <a2_0>transaction translators<a2_0/> that <a0_0>convert between high-speed USB 2.0 buses and full and low speed buses<a0_0/>. <a1_0>When a high-speed USB 2.0 hub is plugged into a high-speed USB host or hub<a1_0/>, it operates in high-speed mode. The USB hub then uses either one transaction translator per hub to create a full/low-speed bus routed to all full and low speed devices on the hub, or uses one transaction translator per port to create an isolated full/low-speed bus per port on the hub.
